conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph's symmetry and conditions.
Graph is symmetric about a dashed vertical line.
Motion before and after the line is mirrored.
Graph shows velocity of the particle at any time t.
Positive slope indicates acceleration; negative slope indicates deceleration; zero velocity indicates change in direction or stationary moment.
Particle passes through a certain position three times within time interval 0 to t1.
Changes in direction or repeated positions at different times are necessary for passing a position three times.
Scenario 1: Particle moves, decelerates, stops, reverses, accelerates back to initial point.
Scenario 2: Particle accelerates, decelerates to stop, reverses, and repeats pattern.
First image shows symmetrical path with minimum point indicating change in velocity direction.
Second image outlines deceleration and acceleration phases.
Particle must undergo changes in direction or velocity reversals.
Changes allow particle to pass through the same position three times within given time frame.
Final answer: Motion involves acceleration, deceleration, and reversals in direction.
